posts.name: William Mickel
posts.cooked: I tried to use Cowlibration to calibrate my cameras in Photonvision, but Iâ€™m being met with near-endless errors. It was made a while ago, and from what I heard, not being updated anymore. It appears the errors are originating from the code itself. Is it a skill issue, or is Cowlibration just too outdated? If it is too outdated, has anyone found adaptations that work, or a full on replacement? Thanks.

posts.name: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)
posts.cooked:
Try WPICal.  It is loaded with WPILib, so you should have it.  Check out docs if needed.

I had okay results, but just starting trying to use it.
posts.display_username: Nelson Green (1108 Mentor Coach Electrical Programming)

posts.name: Dustin
posts.cooked: The Cowlibration tool has been integrated into WPILib as WPICal. You can find instructions on how to use it here .

posts.name: Dan Katzuv
posts.cooked:
You can calibrate your cameras directly in PhotonVision:

To calibrate a camera, images of a Charuco board (or chessboard) are taken. By comparing where the grid corners should be in object space (for example, a corner once every inch in an 8x6 grid) with...

posts.name: William Mickel
posts.cooked:
Hello, thanks for the response.

Iâ€™m aware of the manual calibration available in Photonvision. Iâ€™m attempting to use software developed by FRC 1538, The Holy Cows. The purpose is to allow someone to take a video of the charuco board in different positions, at which point frames will be captured to calibrate the cameras. This allows the processs of calibration to be a lot less tedious.

posts.name: Dustin
posts.cooked: Can you post the error that youâ€™re getting and what commands youâ€™ve ran?

posts.name: William Mickel
posts.cooked:
Sorry for the late reply.

I can post the exacts in maybe a few days, weâ€™re currently in quite a rush.

The general gist was that when downloading the packages in the requirements.txt file, there was an error due to something relating to metadata. After doing some research, it seemed that it was mainly due to outdated packages interacting with an updated python. After attempting to fix that, other errors occured due to the packages that were being downloaded being outdated. Overall, it just seemed that the code was outdated, and beyond my skillset of fixing. Maybe over the dummer i can adapt it, but for now i was looking for an easy fix. Its not the end of the world if i cant get it to work, i would just manually calibrate the cameras.

posts.name: Ryan Blue
posts.cooked: Have you actually tried calibrating with photonvisionâ€™s built in tooling? Itâ€™s really quite simple, Iâ€™d highly recommend giving it a try.

posts.name: William Mickel
posts.cooked: Yep, thats what weâ€™ve been doing, just thought if we could get Cowlibration working it would help reduce workload just a bit, especially if i could get it working during the off-season. If there isnt a suitable adaption or replacement, weâ€™ll just continue with the built-in calibration.
